page.title: 19Gala Day in Ingleton
page.content: Gala Day takes place on a Saturday in Ingleton. The day begins with a parade at 1.30pm where there are floats led by the Pipe Band. The main float is the Gala Queen's float. The Gala Queen is a girl chosen from the Primary School by the pupils. Behind the floats come the people in fancy dress and other attractions. The parade leads all the way around the village and ends up on the football field where there are lots of stalls and activities. This year there was the usual mountain race where competitors race to the top of Ingleborough Hill and back again. The Junior Race goes part of the way up Ingleborough to a place called Crina Bottom. Some of the other attractions were as follows: there was a Punch and Judy show for the small children: there was a maze for older children.
